adk.selectorswitch

Class SelectorUtil

  • java.lang.Object
    • adk.selectorswitch.SelectorUtil

  • class SelectorUtil
extends java.lang.Object
    SelectorUtil is a utility helper class used mainly by SelectorDial and SelectorKnob classes. It offers a range of useful static methods that either transform data from one form to another or return objects constructed using some given data.
    See Also:
    SelectorSwitch, SelectorDial, SelectorKnob

      • arrayToList

        static java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> arrayToList(int[] array)
        Converts an int[] to a List and returns it.
        Parameters:
        array - int[] : array to be converted.
        Returns:
        list List constructed from array.

      • getSweepingAngle

        static float getSweepingAngle(int maxModes)
        Calculates the angle between two successive modes in the selector dial. Every mode in the circular dial is separated equally.
        Parameters:
        maxModes - int : Number of modes in the selector dial.
        Returns:
        sweepingAngle The angle between 2 adjacent modes.

      • generateStartingAngles

        static java.util.List<java.lang.Float> generateStartingAngles(int dialModeCount,
                                                              float sweepingAngle)
        Generates the starting angle for each mode on the dial of the selector.
        Parameters:
        dialModeCount - int : Number of modes in the selector dial.
        sweepingAngle - float : Angle between the starting angles of two successive modes on the dial.
        Returns:
        startingAngles List of starting angles for each mode in the selector dial.

      • generateDialPaints

        static java.util.List<android.graphics.Paint> generateDialPaints(int dialModeCount,
                                                                 java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> colors)
        Generates a list of paint instances based on the mode colors (ints).
        Parameters:
        dialModeCount - int : Number of modes in the selector switch.
        colors - List : List of Color(integers).
        Returns:
        dialPaints List of Paint instances.
        See Also:
        createPaintFromColor(int, Paint.Style, boolean, int, int)

      • generateDialPaint

        static android.graphics.Paint generateDialPaint(int color)
        Generates and returns a single paint object, having the given color, used to draw modes in the selector dial. This paint has Paint.Style.FILL style with no shadow enabled.
        Parameters:
        color - int : Color of the mode.
        Returns:
        paint Paint instance built using the given color.
        See Also:
        SelectorDial.setModeColor(int, int), createPaintFromColor(int, Paint.Style, boolean, int, int)

      • generateBlendingColors

        static java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> generateBlendingColors(int dialModeCount,
                                                                int startingColor,
                                                                int endingColor)
        Generates a list of colors that blend from a starting color to an ending color. The size of the list is same as dialModeCount.
        Parameters:
        dialModeCount - int : Size of the list.
        startingColor - int : Color to start blending from.
        endingColor - int : Color to finally blend into.
        Returns:
        colorList List of Integers representing the blended colors.
        See Also:
        Color.HSVToColor(float[])

      • getPixelsFromDips

        static int getPixelsFromDips(int dps,
                             float density)
        Converts DPs to Pixels based on the screen's pixel density.
        Parameters:
        dps - int : DP units.
        Returns:
        pixels Pixel count equivalent to the given DP units.

      • createPaintFromColor

        static android.graphics.Paint createPaintFromColor(int color,
                                                   android.graphics.Paint.Style style,
                                                   boolean shadowEnabled,
                                                   int shadowColor,
                                                   int shadowLength)
        Returns a paint instance created as per the required specs.
        Parameters:
        color - int : Color of the paint.
        style - Paint.Style> : Style of the paint. Eg - Fill, Stroke, etc.
        shadowEnabled - boolean : Enables shadow for the objects using this paint if true.
        shadowColor - int : Color of the shadow if the shadow is enabled.
        shadowLength - int : Length of the shadow in pixels.
        Returns:
        paint Paint instance created.
        See Also:
        Paint.Style
